content:
This chunk is part of a document explaining Bullet soft body simulation configuration settings, specifically detailing the `btSoftBody::Config` properties and their corresponding `BulletSoftBodyConfig` mappings. The context describes parameters that control soft body behavior, such as interaction hardness between different object types (rigid, kinetic, soft), impulse splits, velocity correction factors, damping, drag, lift, pressure, volume conservation, friction, contact hardness, and solver iterations.

btSoftBody::Config BulletSoftBodyConfig Description kSRHR_CL get/setSoftVsRigidHardness Soft vs rigid hardness (cluster only) Range [0,1] kSKHR_CL get/setSoftVsKineticHardness Soft vs kinetic hardness (cluster only) Range [0,1] kSSHR_CL get/setSoftVsSoftHardness Soft vs soft hardness (cluster only) Range [0,1] kSR_SPLT_CL get/setSoftVsRigidImpulseSplit Soft vs rigid impulse split (cluster only) Range [0,1] kSK_SPLT_CL get/setSoftVsKineticImpulseSplit Soft vs kinetic impulse split (cluster only) Range [0,1] kSS_SPLT_CL get/setSoftVsSoftImpulseSplit Soft vs soft impulse split (cluster only) Range [0,1] kVCF get/setVelocitiesCorrectionFactor Velocities correction factor (Baumgarte) kDP get/setDampingCoefficient Damping coefficient Range [0,1] kDG get/setDragCoefficient Drag coefficient Range [0,+inf] kLF get/setLiftCoefficient Lift coefficient Range [0,+inf] kPR get/setPressureCoefficient Pressure coefficient Range [-inf,+inf] kVC get/setVolumeConversationCoefficient Volume conversation
